sentence.text: Serendipitously, we found that overexpression of negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated in mouse muscle progenitor cells, either constitutively during development or inducibly in adult animals, caused severe muscle atrophy with features reminiscent of cachexia.
Using several genetic mouse models of PDAC, we detected a marked increase in negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated expression in muscle undergoing cachexia.
In cancer patients, elevated levels of negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated are associated with greater degrees of muscle wasting.

Finally, both genetic and pharmacological inactivation of negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated in muscle progenitor cells afforded substantial protection against cancer-mediated cachexia, which translated into meaningful survival benefits, implicating negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated as a possible target for attenuating muscle cachexia in cancer patients
